title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Large Language Models: A Survey

sections.description: Introduce the concept of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and its relevance to enhancing large language models (LLMs) for natural language processing tasks. Discuss the motivation for conducting a survey on this topic, highlighting its importance in addressing challenges such as hallucinations and improving performance.

subsections.description: Explain the fundamental idea of retrieval-augmented generation and its role in enhancing LLM capabilities.

Provide an overview of the organization and structure of the survey paper.

sections.description: Provide an overview of large language models and their limitations, such as hallucinations and memory constraints. Explain the concept of retrieval mechanisms and how they can be integrated with LLMs to address these limitations.
